data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update Rolling Out
data.Description: Google has commenced the rollout of its August 2024 core update, potentially benefiting sites negatively affected by the September Helpful Content Update. However, a significant ranking bug accompanies the update.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Bug Impacts Results
data.Description: A Google Search ranking bug unrelated to the August 2024 core update is affecting a large number of search results. Google has identified the issue and is working on a fix.

data.Title: FTC Bans Fake Reviews
data.Description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has officially banned fake and AI-generated reviews and testimonials, with potential fines of up to $50,000 per violation.

data.Title: Google AI Overviews Expand to New Countries
data.Description: Google's AI-powered search summaries, AI Overviews, are now available in six new countries: India, Japan, Mexico, Indonesia, Brazil, and the United Kingdom.

data.Title: Google Updates AI Overviews with New Link UI and Features
data.Description: Google has updated its AI Overviews with a new link interface, save features, a simpler mode, and expanded availability. The new link treatment is considered similar to Perplexity.

data.Title: Google Doesn't Follow Links in Real-Time
data.Description: Google's Gary Illyes clarifies that the search engine doesn't follow links in real-time. Instead, it extracts, collects, and checks them later, impacting how SEO professionals understand link processing.

data.Title: Google Highlights Review Content in Search Snippets
data.Description: Google Search is giving more prominence to review content within search result snippets, potentially increasing their visibility.

data.Title: Native Advertising: Adapting to Google's 2024 SEO Changes
data.Description: With Google's 2024 SEO changes emphasizing content quality and user experience, native advertising that aligns with user intent is more likely to perform better in search rankings.

data.Title: Walmart Utilizes Generative AI for Product Page Updates
data.Description: Walmart claims that using generative AI to update product pages is 100 times more efficient than manual updates, resulting in the creation or improvement of 850 million pieces of data.
